content.webTitle: Hope Solo and Joey Peters join the Guardian as guest columnists for Women’s World Cup

fields.headline: Hope Solo and Joey Peters join the Guardian as guest columnists for Women’s World Cup
fields.bodyText: The Guardian has signed two legendary footballers as guest columnists throughout the Women’s World Cup Hope Solo, the USA’s World Cup winning goalkeeper with more than 200 caps and former Australian Women’s Footballer of the Year Joey Peters, will be writing for the Guardian on a regular basis throughout the tournament. Hope and Joey will join international footballer and regular Guardian columnist Eni Aluko to share their takes on the competition. The Guardian’s coverage will be led by Suzanne Wrack and Louise Taylor who will be reporting from each and every game, providing readers with minute-by-minute updates on all the action. Will Woodward, head of sport, Guardian News & Media, said: “This Women’s World Cup promises to be the biggest and best yet, and we are delighted to bring our unrivalled roster of women’s football writers and columnists to cover the tournament. It’s fantastic that the Guardian’s British, American and Australian operations are combining to bring the best live, international and interactive coverage.” Suzanne Wrack, women’s sports writer, Guardian News & Media said: “The Guardian was the first newspaper to switch from responsive coverage and commit to regular women’s football coverage two years ago. Now, we are giving this tournament a quality and depth of coverage to match the quality of the increasingly professional product on the pitch - the reporting it deserves. This is going to be the biggest Women’s World Cup in history and it is extremely exciting to be a part of this paper’s game-changing coverage.” The Guardian and Observer’s coverage will also include a host of additional special features, commentary and live blogs to keep readers up to date with every goal including: The Guardian Football Weekly podcast hosted by Max Rushden A definitive squad guide written by expert journalists from all 24 countries in the tournament A comprehensive guide on the history of women’s football and the key moments that have shaped the game -ends- For more information please contact: media.enquiries@theguardian.com or 020 3353 3696 Notes to editors About Guardian News & Media Guardian News & Media (GNM) publishes theguardian.com, one of the world’s leading English-language newspaper websites. Traffic from outside of the UK now represents around two-thirds of the Guardian’s total digital audience. In the UK, GNM publishes the Guardian newspaper six days a week, first published in 1821, and the world’s oldest Sunday newspaper, The Observer. The Guardian is renowned for its agenda-setting journalism including, most recently, the Paradise and Panama Papers investigations as well as the Pulitzer Prize and Emmy-winning NSA revelations.
